questions.question_text:
A company has been storing monthly reports in an Amazon S3 bucket. The company exports the report data into comma-separated values (.csv) files. A developer wants to write a simple query that can read all of these files and generate a summary report.

Which AWS service or feature should the developer use to meet these requirements with the LEAST amount of operational overhead?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon Athena

Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. The developer can use it to write a simple query that can read all of the .csv files in the Amazon S3 bucket and generate a summary report. Athena uses Presto, an open-source query engine, to perform the queries, and it does not require any infrastructure to be provisioned or managed. This means that the developer can use it with the least amount of operational overhead.

Selected Answer: A
A. Amazon S3 Select is the answer 
While Athena can query data in S3, it requires setting up a database schema and potentially managing infrastructure for running queries so it doesnt meet the "LEAST amount of operational overhead" in the requirement 
These are the key words " write a simple query" and "LEAST amount of operational overhead" in the requirement "

Selected Answer: A
least operational overhead are the keywords. Athena requires a GLUE database. A is the answer

Selected Answer: A
S3 Select
A: S3 Select, since it supports CSV and works out of the box without further services

Amazon S3 Select le permite utilizar instrucciones de lenguaje de consulta estructurada (SQL) para filtrar el contenido de los objetos de Amazon S3 y recuperar exactamente el subconjunto de datos que necesita. Si utiliza Amazon S3 Select para filtrar estos datos, puede reducir la cantidad de datos que Amazon S3 transfiere, lo que reduce también los costos y la latencia para recuperarlos.

Amazon S3 Select funciona con objetos almacenados en formato CSV, JSON o Apache Parquet. También funciona con objetos comprimidos con GZIP o BZIP2 (solo para objetos CSV y JSON), así como con objetos cifrados del lado del servidor. Puede especificar el formato de los resultados como CSV o JSON, y también puede determinar cómo se delimitan los registros en los resultados.

A, because the question itself asks for least operational overhead and required a simple query 
Amazon S3 Select, you can use structured query language (SQL) statements to filter the contents of an Amazon S3 object and retrieve only the subset of data that you need. By using Amazon S3 Select to filter this data, you can reduce the amount of data that Amazon S3 transfers, which reduces the cost and latency to retrieve this data.

Amazon S3 Select works on objects stored in CSV, JSON, or Apache Parquet format.

Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon Athena

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

Selected Answer: B
Analytics on top of S3 Data => Amazon Athena
It is B

Selected Answer: B
Yes, it's B
s3 select only runs queries on a single object , while Athena can operate on multiple.. The question mentions CVS FILES... I say Athena

Selected Answer: B
https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/aws/amazon-athena-interactive-sql-queries-for-data-in-amazon-s3/
https://aws.amazon.com/s3/features/#s3-select

D. Elasticity

Elasticity in the AWS Cloud refers to the capability to dynamically adjust resources to match varying workloads. It allows scaling resources up or down as needed to handle increases or decreases in demand, ensuring that the company can accommodate peak application usage without investing in additional hardware infrastructure permanently.

Selected Answer: D
D. Elasticity
resposta correta D

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D

Selected Answer: D
The benefit that the company is seeking in AWS Cloud is D. Elasticity.

Elasticity is the ability of a system to automatically provision and de-provision resources based on the changing workload demands. AWS provides a variety of services that can be scaled up or down quickly and automatically, allowing companies to adjust their computing resources as needed to accommodate fluctuations in application usage. This means that companies can avoid over-provisioning resources and paying for unused capacity, and also can handle peak workloads without purchasing additional hardware.

Therefore, the correct option is D. Elasticity.

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer.

Selected Answer: D
Elasticity
The ability to acquire resources as you need them and release resources when you no longer need them. In the cloud, you want to do this automatically.
 
Ref link: https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.elasticity.en.html

Selected Answer: D
Peak application means refers to elasticity

i think D is the correct the answer
D Elasticity

Selected Answer: D

questions.question_text:
A company wants the ability to accommodate peak application usage without purchasing equipment for on-premises data centers.

Which AWS Cloud benefit is the company seeking?
Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
For the well-architectured framework (WAF), just remember the mnemonic CROPS(S)
1. Cost Optimization
2. Reliability
3. Operational Excellence
4. Performance Efficiency
5. Security
(6. Sustainability - Recent addition)
this page is not reliable, availability is not a pillar, the right choice is B

Selected Answer: BE
B. Reliability
E. Operational excellence

Selected Answer: BE
BE is the answer.

Selected Answer: BE
BE is the answer
B and E

Selected Answer: BE
B and E
B and E

Selected Answer: BE
vote for B,E
BE - Reliability & operational excellence

Selected Answer: BE
Reliability and operational excellennce
Reliability & operational excellence
BE is the answer

Selected Answer: BE
Reliability and operational excellennce

BE is the answer 
The Well-Architected Framework is based on six pillars: 

 Operational excellence
 Security
 Reliability
 Performance efficiency
 Cost optimization
 Sustainability

B and E are well.

B: Reliability and E: Operational Excellence

questions.question_text: Which AWS service provides highly durable object storage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Amazon S3

"Amazon S3 is object storage built to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere. S3 is a simple storage service that offers industry leading durability, availability, performance, security, and virtually unlimited scalability at very low costs."

https://aws.amazon.com/s3/faqs/?nc=sn&loc=7

Selected Answer: A
A is the answer.

Selected Answer: A
Durability, availability, and scalability
Amazon S3 was built from the ground up to deliver 99.999999999% (11 9s) of data durability. With Amazon S3, your objects are redundantly stored on multiple devices across a minimum of three Availability Zones (AZs) in an Amazon S3 Region. Amazon S3 is designed to sustain concurrent device failures by quickly detecting and repairing any lost redundancy, and it also regularly verifies the integrity of your data using checksums.
 
Ref link: https://aws.amazon.com/what-is/object-storage/#:~:text=Amazon%20S3%20offers%20a%20highly,protection%20for%20your%20stored%20data.

Selected Answer: A
https://aws.amazon.com/s3/faqs/

questions.question_text:
A company needs to migrate all of its development teams to a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE).

Which AWS service should the company use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Cloud9

AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that allows a company to write, run, and debug code on a browser-based interface. It provides a collaborative, browser-based environment that includes a code editor, a terminal, and a debugger. The service also integrates with AWS services such as Lambda, Elastic Beanstalk, and EC2 to provide a seamless experience for developers. The company can use it to migrate all of its development teams to a cloud-based IDE

A. AWS CodeBuild: AWS CodeBuild is a fully managed build service that compiles source code, runs tests, and produces software packages that are ready to deploy. It does not provide an integrated development environment.

Selected Answer: B
its a like VScode

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Cloud9

"AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that lets you write, run, and debug your code with just a browser. It includes a code editor, debugger, and terminal. Cloud9 comes prepackaged with essential tools for popular programming languages, including JavaScript, Python, PHP, and more, so you don’t need to install files or configure your development machine to start new projects."

https://aws.amazon.com/cloud9/

Selected Answer: B
The AWS service that the company should use for migrating all of its development teams to a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) is B. AWS Cloud9.

AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based IDE that allows developers to write, run, and debug code with just a web browser. It supports several programming languages, including Python, JavaScript, and PHP, and integrates with other AWS services such as AWS Lambda and AWS CodeCommit.

Therefore, the correct option is B. AWS Cloud9.

Selected Answer: B
To provide a cloud-based IDE, the company can use AWS Cloud9, which is an integrated development environment that runs in the cloud. It provides a web-based interface that developers can use to write, run, and debug code. AWS Cloud9 is integrated with many other AWS services, such as AWS CodeCommit, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS CodePipeline, which can be used to create a full software development pipeline in the cloud. Additionally, AWS Cloud9 also supports popular programming languages and frameworks, so developers can work in the language they prefer.

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Cloud9

AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that allows users to write, run, and debug code from within a web browser. It provides a range of features and tools for developing, testing, and debugging applications, including support for a wide range of programming languages, code completion, debugging, and collaboration tools.

To migrate its development teams to a cloud-based IDE, the company can use AWS Cloud9 to create a workspace for each team, and invite team members to join the workspace. The company can then use Cloud9 to develop, test, and debug applications, and to collaborate with other team members in real-time.

Selected Answer: B
AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that lets you write, run, and debug your code with just a browser.
